name: Design
info:
This layout is designed to roughly replicate
the Node-RED Dashboard grid layout.

It keeps the outer layout from the content/blog
style (header, footer, left-sidebar, main).

But the sidebar now has the navigation menu
instead of the header.

The main content area is now a sub-grid. It has
the `id` of `more` which means that you can
easily add new content using uibuilder's 
no-code nodes.

Each `<article>` or `<div>` tag in the main 
content sub-grid can be considered the 
equivalent of a "widget" in Node-RED Dashboard 
terms. It can contain whatever you want it to.
It has a slightly different background colour
and a rounded border.

In the example all of the layout can be
controlled from the CSS variables in `:root`.

The sub-grid has 12 columns by default, you
can change that to whatever is useful to you.

The articles have a default width of 3. You can
easily override a single article by adding:
`--article-width: 6` or however many columns
you want it to take up.

By default, specific grid rows are undefined
(set to `auto`) so articles take up whatever
height they need. If you want to define the
rows, you can easily do so by changing
`--main-rows` to `repeat(12, 1fr)` or some
other number. You have lots of control over the
column/row layout but it can get a bit complex
so you are advised to keep it simple, at least
to start with.

-----------------

## NOTES

It is very likely that much of the
defined CSS in this example will be incorporated
into UIBUILDER's `uib-brand.css` in the 
future.

The Markdown-IT library has been included in
`index.html`, loaded from a public Internet
CDN. Install & use the library locally using 
UIBUILDER's library manager if you prefer.
Or remove completely if you don't need to use
Markdown dynamic content.
